Carettochelyidae.Description: The Carettochelyidae family of turtles — more commonly known as "Pig-nosed turtle" — were first discovered in 1887 by Boulenger.

Cheloniidae.Description: The Cheloniidae family of turtles — more commonly known as "Sea turtles" — were first discovered in 1811 by Oppel.

Chelydridae.Description: The Chelydridae family of turtles — more commonly known as "Snapping turtles" — were first discovered in 1831 by Gray.

Dermatemydidae.Description: The Dermatemydidae family of turtles — more commonly known as "Central American river turtle" — were first discovered in 1870 by Gray.

Dermochelyidae.Description: The Dermochelyidae family of turtles — more commonly known as "Leatherback sea turtle" — were first discovered in 1843 by Fitzinger.

Emydidae.Description: The Emydidae family of turtles — more commonly known as "Pond or water turtles" — were first discovered in 1815 by Rafinesque.

Geoemydidae.Description: The Geoemydidae family of turtles — more commonly known as "Asian river, leaf, roofed or Asian box turtles" — were first discovered in 1868 by Theobald.

Kinosternidae.Description: The Kinosternidae family of turtles — more commonly known as "Mud or musk turtles" — were first discovered in 1857 by Agassiz.

Platysternidae.Description: The Platysternidae family of turtles — more commonly known as "Big-headed turtle" — were first discovered in 1869 by Gray.

Testudinidae.Description: The Testudinidae family of turtles — more commonly known as "Tortoises" — were first discovered in 1788 by Batsch.

Trionychidae.Description: The Trionychidae family of turtles — more commonly known as "Softshell turtles" — were first discovered in 1826 by Fitzinger.

Chelidae.Description: The Chelidae family of turtles — more commonly known as "Austro-American sideneck turtles" — were first discovered in 1831 by Gray.

Pelomedusidae.Description: The Pelomedusidae family of turtles — more commonly known as "Afro-American sideneck turtles" — were first discovered in 1868 by Cope.

Podocnemididae.Description: The Podocnemididae family of turtles — more commonly known as "Madagascar big-headed, Big-headed Amazon River turtle and South American sideneck river turtles" — were first discovered in 1869 by Gray.
